item.title: ConceptS: Our new Multitouch Wall
item.description:
Quite a long time since we didn’t show our work done in pre-summer-holidays time at IIT delhi’s Design lab. Here’s a sneak peek into the multitouch wall done by Sparsh team during their IIT Delhi stay.

Hail NUI :) The upcoming video will show some custom applications with object marking.

Building the wall at IIT Delhi’s design lab was proper jugaad – we sourced a projector, an acrylic sheet, IR LEDs, and a PS3 Eye camera, put it all together in a couple of days. The best part was showing it to people who’d never seen multitouch before, their faces when objects on screen responded to their fingers was priceless. Sparsh team putting it together with almost zero budget, that’s how we roll :P

item.title: First Prize at IIT Kanpur's Techkriti
item.description:
We got our table running at Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur’s annual technical festival- Techkriti, one of the largest ones in India and voila! got First Prize there :)

Number of Teams at the exhibit - 20 Number of Projects that applied - approx 400

A lot of hardware including the whole wooden box setup and the large projector had to be shipped around 300 Kilometers from here- and explaining Multitouch/FTIR/NUIGroup to the audience for 3 long days countless number of times. And that paid off well :) with some moolah raking in, well the first prize got us richer by Rs. 30000/- , enough money to let us by the new Lasers and a couple of cameras for a new multitouch setup.
